knob.name: BluetoothSar
knob.description: Define the mode of SAR control to be used. Disabled: Tx power shall be mandated by device NVM Enabled: Tx power shall be the minimum between BIOS SAR table and BT Device NVM (either Module or Platform)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/ Bluetooth SAR

knob.name: BluetoothSarBr
knob.description: Defines the SAR power restriction for BR Modulation
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/ Bluetooth SAR BR

knob.name: BluetoothSarEdr2
knob.description: Defines the SAR power restriction for EDR2 Modulation
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/ Bluetooth SAR EDR2

knob.name: BluetoothSarEdr3
knob.description: Defines the SAR power restriction for EDR3 Modulation
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/ Bluetooth SAR EDR3

knob.name: BluetoothSarLe
knob.description: Defines the SAR power restriction for LE Modulation
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/ Bluetooth SAR LE

knob.name: BluetoothSarLe2Mhz
knob.description: Defines the SAR power restriction for LE 2Mhz Modulation
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/ Bluetooth SAR LE 2Mhz

knob.name: BluetoothSarLeLr
knob.description: Defines the SAR power restriction for LE LR Modulation
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Connectivity Configuration/ Bluetooth SAR LE LR

knob.name: OverclockingSupport
knob.description: Performance Menu for Processor and Memory.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/OverClocking Feature

knob.name: WdtEnable
knob.description: Enable/Disable WatchDog Timer. Note: This option is ignored on debug BIOS.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/WDT Enable

knob.name: XtuInterfaceEnable
knob.description: Enable/Disable XTU Interface. BIOS will only expose XTU interface when enabled.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/XTU Interface

knob.name: BclkAdaptiveVoltageEnable
knob.description: BCLK Aware Adaptive Voltage enable/disable. When enabled, pcode will be aware of the BCLK frequency when calculating the CPU V/F curves. This is ideal for BCLK OC to avoid high voltage overrides. Uses OC Mailbox command 0x15.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/BCLK Aware Adaptive Voltage

knob.name: FivrFaults
knob.description: Enable/Disable Fivr Faults. Default is enabled. When FIVR faults are disabled, over-voltage and over-current protections are disabled. Extreme OC will require faults to be disabled, but presents reliability risks.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/FIVR Faults

knob.name: FivrEfficiency
knob.description: Enable/Disable FIVR Effiency. Default is enabled. Efficiency management is good for power delivery, but may impede OC. Disabling FIVR efficiency will force FIVR to always run in max power delivery mode.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/FIVR Efficiency

knob.name: VccInVoltageOverride
knob.description: Specifies the Fixed VccIn Voltage override. Used to override the external VccIn input voltage of the CPU. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x23. Range 0-3000 mV.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/VccIn Voltage Override

knob.name: NonCoreHighVoltageMode
knob.description: Enable High Voltage Mode in the non-core FIVR domains (Ring/GT). Used for LN2 cold boot mitigation. Sets the CPU strap for non-core HVM. Default is Disabled.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Non-core High Voltage Mode

knob.name: CoreHighVoltageMode
knob.description: Enable High Voltage Mode in the core FIVR domains. Used for LN2 cold boot mitigation. Sets the CPU strap for core HVM. Default is Disabled.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Core High Voltage Mode

knob.name: CoreMaxOcRatio
knob.description: Sets the maximum OC Ratio for the CPU Core. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11. Range 0-120.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Core Max OC Ratio

knob.name: CoreVoltageMode
knob.description: Selects between Adaptive and Override Voltage modes. In Override Mode the voltage selected will be applied over all operating frequencies. In Adaptive Mode the voltage is interpolated only in turbo mode. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Core Voltage Mode

knob.name: CoreVoltageOverride
knob.description: Specifies the Override Voltage applied to the IA Core domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Core Voltage Override

knob.name: CoreExtraTurboVoltage
knob.description: Specifies the extra turbo voltage applied while IA Core is operating in turbo mode. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Core Extra Turbo Voltage

knob.name: CoreVoltageOffset
knob.description: Specifies the Offset Voltage applied to the IA Core domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range -500 to 500 mV
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Core Voltage Offset

knob.name: CoreVoltageOffsetPrefix
knob.description: Sets the offset value as positive or negative.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/ Offset Prefix

knob.name: Avx2RatioOffset
knob.description: AVX2 Ratio Offset. Specifies number of bins to decrease AVX ratio vs. Core Ratio. AVX is a more stressful workload, it is helpful to lower the AVX ratio to ensure maximum possible ratio for SSE workloads. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x1B. Range 0 - 31. 0 - No offset.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/AVX2 Ratio Offset

knob.name: Avx2GuardBand
knob.description: AVX2 Voltage Guardband Scale Factor. Controls the voltage guardband applied to AVX workloads. Range 0 - 200 in 1/100 units, where 125 - 1.25 scale factor. Default - 0, no scale factor applied. A value of 100 applies the default voltage guardband scale factor of 1.0. A value ? 100 will increase the votlage guardband, and ? 100 will decrease the voltage guardband.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/AVX2 Voltage Guardband Scale Factor

knob.name: Avx3RatioOffset
knob.description: AVX512 Ratio Offset. Specifies number of bins to decrease AVX ratio vs. Core Ratio. AVX is a more stressful workload, it is helpful to lower the AVX ratio to ensure maximum possible ratio for SSE workloads. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x1B. Range 0 - 31. 0 - No offset.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/AVX512 Ratio Offset

knob.name: Avx512GuardBand
knob.description: AVX512 Voltage Guardband Scale Factor. Controls the voltage guardband applied to AVX workloads. Range 0 - 200 in 1/100 units, where 125 - 1.25 scale factor. Default - 0, no scale factor applied. A value of 100 applies the default voltage guardband scale factor of 1.0. A value ? 100 will increase the votlage guardband, and ? 100 will decrease the voltage guardband.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/AVX512 Voltage Guardband Scale Factor

knob.name: TjMaxOffset
knob.description: TjMax Offset. Specified value here is clipped by pCode (125 - TjMax Offset) to support TjMax in the range of 62 to 115 deg Celsius. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x37, command 0x01. Range 10 - 63. 0 - No offset.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/TjMax Offset

knob.name: PerCoreRatioLimit_0
knob.description: Per Core Ratio Limit. Range 0-120. 0 - No programming of per core ratio limit. The Ratio cannot go below the CPU LFM ratio.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Per Core Ratio Limits/Core 0 Ratio Limit

knob.name: PerCoreRatioLimit_1
knob.description: Per Core Ratio Limit. Range 0-120. 0 - No programming of per core ratio limit. The Ratio cannot go below the CPU LFM ratio.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Per Core Ratio Limits/Core 1 Ratio Limit

knob.name: PerCoreRatioLimit_2
knob.description: Per Core Ratio Limit. Range 0-120. 0 - No programming of per core ratio limit. The Ratio cannot go below the CPU LFM ratio.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Per Core Ratio Limits/Core 2 Ratio Limit

knob.name: PerCoreRatioLimit_3
knob.description: Per Core Ratio Limit. Range 0-120. 0 - No programming of per core ratio limit. The Ratio cannot go below the CPU LFM ratio.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Per Core Ratio Limits/Core 3 Ratio Limit

knob.name: PerCoreRatioLimit_4
knob.description: Per Core Ratio Limit. Range 0-120. 0 - No programming of per core ratio limit. The Ratio cannot go below the CPU LFM ratio.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Per Core Ratio Limits/Core 4 Ratio Limit

knob.name: PerCoreRatioLimit_5
knob.description: Per Core Ratio Limit. Range 0-120. 0 - No programming of per core ratio limit. The Ratio cannot go below the CPU LFM ratio.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Per Core Ratio Limits/Core 5 Ratio Limit

knob.name: PerCoreRatioLimit_6
knob.description: Per Core Ratio Limit. Range 0-120. 0 - No programming of per core ratio limit. The Ratio cannot go below the CPU LFM ratio.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Per Core Ratio Limits/Core 6 Ratio Limit

knob.name: PerCoreRatioLimit_7
knob.description: Per Core Ratio Limit. Range 0-120. 0 - No programming of per core ratio limit. The Ratio cannot go below the CPU LFM ratio.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Processor/Per Core Ratio Limits/Core 7 Ratio Limit

knob.name: RingMaxOcRatio
knob.description: Sets the maximum OC Ratio for the CPU Ring. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11. Range 0-85.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Ring Max OC Ratio

knob.name: RingVoltageMode
knob.description: Selects between Adaptive and Override Voltage modes. In Override Mode the voltage selected will be applied over all operating frequencies. In Adaptive Mode the voltage is interpolated only in turbo mode. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Ring Voltage Mode

knob.name: RingVoltageOverride
knob.description: Specifies the Override Voltage applied to the Ring domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Ring Voltage Override

knob.name: RingExtraTurboVoltage
knob.description: Specifies the extra turbo voltage applied while ring is operating in turbo mode. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Ring Extra Turbo Voltage

knob.name: RingVoltageOffset
knob.description: Specifies the Offset Voltage applied to the Ring domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range -500 to 500 mV
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Ring Voltage Offset

knob.name: RingVoltageOffsetPrefix
knob.description: Sets the offset value as positive or negative.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/ Offset Prefix

knob.name: RingDownBin
knob.description: Enable/Disable Ring Downbin feature. Enabled - CPU will down bin the ring ratio, which means the requested max ring ratio will not be observed. Disable - CPU will not down bin the ring ratio and the requested ring ratio limit will be observed. Default for Overclocking is ?Disabled? to allow for a predictable ring ratio. Uses OC mailbox command 0x19.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Ring Down Bin

knob.name: MinRingRatioLimit
knob.description: This sets the minimum ring ratio limit. 0 - Auto/HW default. 1-LFM are invalid ratio settings.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Min Ring Ratio Limit

knob.name: MaxRingRatioLimit
knob.description: This sets the maximum ring ratio limit. 0 - Auto/HW default. 1-LFM are invalid ratio settings.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Ring/Max Ring Ratio Limit

knob.name: GtMaxOcRatio
knob.description: Overclocked RP0 Frequency (MLC Clk) in multiples of 50 MHz
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/GT OverClocking Frequency

knob.name: GtVoltageMode
knob.description: Selects between Adaptive and Override Voltage modes. In Override Mode the voltage selected will be applied over all operating frequencies. In Adaptive Mode the voltage is interpolated only in turbo mode. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/ GT Voltage Mode

knob.name: GtVoltageOverride
knob.description: Specifies the Override Voltage applied to the GT domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/ GT Voltage Override

knob.name: GtExtraTurboVoltage
knob.description: Specifies the extra turbo voltage applied while GT is operating in turbo mode. Unit is in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/ GT Extra Turbo Voltage

knob.name: GtVoltageOffset
knob.description: Specifies the Offset Voltage applied to the GT domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range -1000 to 1000 mV
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/ GT Voltage Offset

knob.name: GtVoltageOffsetPrefix
knob.description: Sets the offset value as positive or negative.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/ Offset Prefix

knob.name: GtusMaxOcRatio
knob.description: Overclocked RP0 Frequency (MLC Clk) in multiples of 50 MHz
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/GT OverClocking Frequency

knob.name: GtusVoltageMode
knob.description: Selects between Adaptive and Override Voltage modes. In Override Mode the voltage selected will be applied over all operating frequencies. In Adaptive Mode the voltage is interpolated only in turbo mode. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x10, 0x11.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/ GT Voltage Mode

knob.name: GtusVoltageOverride
knob.description: Specifies the Override Voltage applied to the GT domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/ GT Voltage Override

knob.name: GtusExtraTurboVoltage
knob.description: Specifies the extra turbo voltage applied while GT is operating in turbo mode. Unit is in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range 0-2000 mV
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/ GT Extra Turbo Voltage

knob.name: GtusVoltageOffset
knob.description: Specifies the Offset Voltage applied to the GT domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range -1000 to 1000 mV
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/ GTU Voltage Offset

knob.name: GtusVoltageOffsetPrefix
knob.description: Sets the offset value as positive or negative.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/GT/ Offset Prefix

knob.name: UncoreVoltageOffset
knob.description: Specifies the Offset Voltage applied to the Uncore domain. This voltage is specified in millivolts. Uses Mailbox MSR 0x150, cmd 0x11. Range -1000 to 1000 mV
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Uncore/Uncore Voltage Offset

knob.name: UncoreVoltageOffsetPrefix
knob.description: Sets the offset value as positive or negative.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Uncore/ Offset Prefix

knob.name: RealtimeMemoryTiming
knob.description: Enable/Disable realtime memory timings. When enabled, the system will allow performing realtime memory timing changes after MRC_DONE.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/Realtime Memory Timing

knob.name: SpdProfileSelected
knob.description: Select DIMM timing profile. The below values start with the currently running values and don?t auto populate.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/Memory profile

knob.name: DdrRefClk
knob.description: 100MHz, 133MHz.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/Memory Reference Clock

knob.name: DdrRatio
knob.description: 0 - Auto, or the frequency will equal ratio times reference clock. Set to 0 (Auto) to recalculate memory timings listed below.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/Memory Ratio

knob.name: tCL
knob.description: CAS Latency, 0: AUTO, max: 31
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ tCL

knob.name: tRCDtRP
knob.description: RAS to CAS delay time and Row Precharge delay time, 0: AUTO, max: 63
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ tRCD/tRP

knob.name: tRAS
knob.description: RAS Active Time, 0: AUTO, max: 64
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ tRAS

knob.name: tCWL
knob.description: Min CAS Write Latency Delay Time, 0: AUTO, max: 20
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ tCWL

knob.name: tFAW
knob.description: Min Four Activate Window Delay Time, 0: AUTO, max: 63
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ tFAW

knob.name: tREFI
knob.description: Refresh Interval, 0: AUTO, max: 65535
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ tREFI

knob.name: tRFC
knob.description: Min Refresh Recovery Delay Time, 0: AUTO, max: 1023
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ tRFC

knob.name: tRRD
knob.description: Min Row Active to Row Active Delay Time, 0: AUTO, max: 31
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ tRRD

knob.name: tRTP
knob.description: Min Internal Read to Precharge Command Delay Time, 0: AUTO, max: 15. DDR4 legal values: 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 12
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ tRTP

knob.name: tWR
knob.description: Min Write Recovery Time, 0: AUTO, legal values: 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16, 18, 20, 24
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ tWR

knob.name: tWTR
knob.description: Min Internal Write to Read Command Delay Time, 0: AUTO, max: 28
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ tWTR

knob.name: NModeSupport
knob.description: System command rate, range 0-2, 0 means auto, 1 - 1N, 2 - 2N
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/ NMode

knob.name: MemoryVoltage
knob.description: Memory Voltage Override (Vddq). Default - no override
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/Memory Voltage

knob.name: DllBwEn0
knob.description: DllBwEn[0], for 1067 (0..7)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/DllBwEn[0]

knob.name: DllBwEn1
knob.description: DllBwEn[1], for 1333 (0..7)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/DllBwEn[1]

knob.name: DllBwEn2
knob.description: DllBwEn[2], for 1600 (0..7)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/DllBwEn[2]

knob.name: DllBwEn3
knob.description: DllBwEn[3], for 1867 and up (0..7)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Memory/DllBwEn[3]

knob.name: CorePllVoltageOffset
knob.description: PLL Voltage Offset, Range 0-63. Units are in 17.5mV. Default is 0. This control can be used to increase the range of this domain frequency in extreme overclocking conditions.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Voltage PLL Trim Controls/Core PLL Voltage Offset

knob.name: GtPllVoltageOffset
knob.description: PLL Voltage Offset, Range 0-63. Units are in 17.5mV. Default is 0. This control can be used to increase the range of this domain frequency in extreme overclocking conditions.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Voltage PLL Trim Controls/GT PLL Voltage Offset

knob.name: RingPllVoltageOffset
knob.description: PLL Voltage Offset, Range 0-63. Units are in 17.5mV. Default is 0. This control can be used to increase the range of this domain frequency in extreme overclocking conditions.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Voltage PLL Trim Controls/Ring PLL Voltage Offset

knob.name: SaPllVoltageOffset
knob.description: PLL Voltage Offset, Range 0-63. Units are in 17.5mV. Default is 0. This control can be used to increase the range of this domain frequency in extreme overclocking conditions.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Voltage PLL Trim Controls/System Agent PLL Voltage Offset

knob.name: McPllVoltageOffset
knob.description: PLL Voltage Offset, Range 0-63. Units are in 17.5mV. Default is 0. This control can be used to increase the range of this domain frequency in extreme overclocking conditions.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Voltage PLL Trim Controls/Memory Controller PLL Voltage Offset

knob.name: FivrTdc

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/OverClocking Performance Menu/Overclocking Interface Controls/FIVR TDC

knob.name: RstPcieRemapEnabled_0

knob.depex: (PchSata != 0) AND (SataInterfaceMode == 1) AND (SETUP_VOLATILE_DATA.CycleRouterMap_0 != 99) AND (SETUP_VOLATILE_DATA.PcieStorageMap_0 != 0) AND ((RstPcieRemapEnabled_1 != 1) AND (RstPcieRemapEnabled_2 != 1) AND (RstPcieRemapEnabled_3 != 1) AND (SETUP_VOLATILE_DATA.PcieStorageProgrammingInterface_0 != 0))

knob.name: PchHdAudio
knob.description: Control Detection of the HD-Audio device. Disabled - HDA will be unconditionally disabled Enabled - HDA will be unconditionally enabled.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/HD Audio Configuration/HD Audio

knob.name: PchHdAudioDsp
knob.description: Enable/Disable Audio DSP.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/HD Audio Configuration/ Audio DSP

knob.name: PchHdAudioDspUaaCompliance
knob.description: Specifies DSP enabled system compliance: 1. Non-UAA (IntelSST driver support only - CC_040100) 2. UAA (HD Audio Inbox or IntelSST driver support - CC_040380) Note: NHLT (DMIC/BT/I2S configuration) is published for non-UAA only.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/HD Audio Configuration/ Audio DSP Compliance Mode

knob.name: PchHdAudioLinkMode
knob.description: Selects link mode: Intel HD Audio link, SSP (I2S) or SoundWire. Interfaces enabled: 1) HDA: HDA-Link[SDI0-1], DMIC[0-1] 2) I2S: SSP[0-5], DMIC[0-1] 3) SNDW: SNDW[1-4] 4) Advanced: Allows to enable each interface separately. Note: DMIC link is required to publish DMIC endpoint configuration in NHLT. SSP link is required to publish I2S/BT endpoint configuration in NHLT.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/HD Audio Configuration/ Audio Link Mode

knob.name: PchHdAudioNhltExternalTable
knob.description: Load external NHLT table from binary file instead of using NHLT built from policy setting.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/HD Audio Configuration/HD Audio DSP Features Configuration/ NHLT External Table

knob.name: PchHdAudioNhltEndpointDmic
knob.description: Selects DMIC to expose in NHLT ACPI table
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/HD Audio Configuration/HD Audio DSP Features Configuration/ DMIC

knob.name: PchHdAudioNhltEndpointBluetooth
knob.description: Enables/Disables Bluetooth Endpoint in NHLT ACPI table
knob.depex: (PchHdAudioDspUaaCompliance == 0x0) AND (PchHdAudioNhltExternalTable != 1) AND (((PchHdAudioLinkMode != 0) AND (PchHdAudioLinkMode != 2) AND ((PchHdAudioLinkMode != 3) OR (PchHdAudioLinkConfig_3 != 0) OR (PchHdAudioLinkConfig_4 != 0) OR (PchHdAudioLinkConfig_5 != 0))) OR (match (stringref (STRING_TOKEN (0x0132)), stringref (STRING_TOKEN (0x0131)))))
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/HD Audio Configuration/HD Audio DSP Features Configuration/ Bluetooth

knob.name: PchHdAudioNhltEndpointI2s
knob.description: Enables/Disables I2S Endpoint in NHLT ACPI table.
knob.depex: (PchHdAudioDspUaaCompliance == 0x0) AND (PchHdAudioNhltExternalTable != 1) AND ((PchHdAudioLinkMode != 0) AND (PchHdAudioLinkMode != 2) AND ((PchHdAudioLinkMode != 3) OR (PchHdAudioLinkConfig_3 != 0) OR (PchHdAudioLinkConfig_4 != 0) OR (PchHdAudioLinkConfig_5 != 0)))
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/HD Audio Configuration/HD Audio DSP Features Configuration/ I2S

knob.name: PchHdAudioI2sCodecSelect
knob.description: Selects I2S Audio Codec support. Note: SerialIo UART0 must be disabled to enable external I2S codec (due to GPIO pin muxing).
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/HD Audio Configuration/HD Audio DSP Features Configuration/ I2S Codec Select

knob.description: Enable/Disable the PCH BIOS Lock Enable feature. Required to be enabled to ensure SMM protection of flash.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/Security Configuration/BIOS Lock

knob.name: UnlockGpioPads
knob.prompt: Force unlock on all GPIO pads
knob.description: If Enabled BIOS will force all GPIO pads to be in unlocked state
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/Security Configuration/Force unlock on all GPIO pads

knob.name: PchSerialIoI2c_0
knob.description: Enables/Disables SerialIo Controller If given device is Function 0 PSF disabling is skipped. PSF default will remain and device PCI CFG Space will still be visible. This is needed to allow PCI enumerator access functions above 0 in a multifunction device. The following devices depend on each other: I2C0 and I2C1,2,3 UART0 and UART1,SPI0,1 UART2 and I2C4,5 UART 0 (00:30:00) cannot be disabled when: 1. Child device is enabled like CNVi Bluetooth (\_SB.PCI0.UA00.BTH0) UART 0 (00:30:00) cannot be enabled when: 1. I2S Audio codec is enabled (\_SB.PCI0.I2C0.HDAC)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/PCH-IO Configuration/SerialIo Configuration/I2C0 Controller

Out of Spec: ACPI Thermal Management uses EC reported temperature values and DTS SMM is used to handle Out of Spec condition.

knob.name: Ac0FanSpeed
knob.description: Active Trip Point 0 Fan Speed in percentage. Value must be between 0 (Fan off) - 100 (Max fan speed). This is the speed at which fan will run when Active Trip Point 0 is crossed.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/Active Trip Point 0 Fan Speed

knob.name: Ac1TripPoint
knob.description: This value controls the temperature of the ACPI Active Trip Point 1 - the point in which the OS will turn the processor fan on Active Trip Point 1 Fan Speed.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/Active Trip Point 1

knob.name: Ac1FanSpeed
knob.description: Active Trip Point 1 Fan Speed in percentage. Value must be between 0 (Fan off) - 100 (Max fan speed). This value must be less than Active Trip Point 0 Fan speed. This is the speed at which fan will run when Active Trip 1 is crossed.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/Active Trip Point 1 Fan Speed

knob.name: PassiveThermalTripPoint
knob.description: This value controls the temperature of the ACPI Passive Trip Point - the point in which the OS will begin throttling the processor.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/Passive Trip Point

knob.name: PassiveTc1Value
knob.description: This value sets the TC1 value for the ACPI Passive Cooling Formula. Range 1 - 16
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/ Passive TC1 Value

knob.name: PassiveTc2Value
knob.description: This value sets the TC2 value for the ACPI Passive Cooling Formula. Range 1 - 16
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/ Passive TC2 Value

knob.name: PassiveTspValue
knob.description: This item sets the TSP value for the ACPI Passive Cooling Formula. It represents in tenths of a second how often the OS will read the temperature when passive cooling is enabled. Range 2 - 32
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/ Passive TSP Value

knob.name: DisableActiveTripPoints
knob.description: Disable Active Trip Points
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/Active Trip Points

knob.name: DisablePassiveTripPoints
knob.description: Disable Passive Trip Points
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/Passive Trip Points

knob.name: DisableCriticalTripPoints
knob.description: Disable Critical Trip Points
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/Critical Trip Points

knob.name: PCHTempReadEnable
knob.description: PCH Temperature Read Enable
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/PCH Temp Read

knob.name: CPUEnergyReadEnable
knob.description: CPU Energy Read Enable
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/CPU Energy Read

knob.name: CPUTempReadEnable
knob.description: CPU Temperature Read Enable
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/CPU Temp Read

knob.name: AlertEnableLock
knob.description: Lock all Alert Enable settings
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/Alert Enable Lock

knob.name: PchAlert
knob.description: PCH Alert pin enable
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/ PCH Alert

knob.name: DimmAlert
knob.description: DIMM Alert pin enable
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/ DIMM Alert

knob.name: CpuTemp
knob.description: Help on CPU Temperature
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/CPU Temp

knob.name: CpuFanSpeed
knob.description: Fan speed that EC will use if OS is hung
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Platform Thermal Configuration/CPU Fan Speed

knob.name: EnableDptf
knob.description: Enable/Disable Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning

knob.name: EnableInt3400Device
knob.description: Enable/Disable the INT3400 Device.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/INT3400 Device

knob.name: EnableSaDevice
knob.description: Enable/Disable Processor Thermal Device.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/Processor Thermal Device

knob.name: ActiveThermalTripPointSA
knob.description: This value controls the temperature of the ACPI Active Thermal Trip Point. NOTE: a value of zero will cause the Intel Dynamic Tuning driver to disable the trip point.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ Active Thermal Trip Point

knob.name: PassiveThermalTripPointSA
knob.description: This value controls the temperature of the ACPI Passive Thermal Trip Point. NOTE: a value of zero will cause the Intel Dynamic Tuning driver to disable the trip point.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ Passive Thermal Trip Point

knob.name: CriticalThermalTripPointSA
knob.description: This value controls the temperature of the ACPI Critical Thermal Trip Point. NOTE: a value of zero will cause the Intel Dynamic Tuning driver to disable the trip point.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ Critical Thermal Trip Point

knob.name: CriticalThermalTripPointSaS3
knob.description: This value controls the temperature of the ACPI Critical Thermal Trip Point for entering S3 or CS. NOTE: a value of zero will cause the Intel Dynamic Tuning driver to disable the trip point.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ S3/CS Thermal Trip Point

knob.name: HotThermalTripPointSA
knob.description: This value controls the temperature of the ACPI Hot Thermal Trip Point. NOTE: a value of zero will cause the Intel Dynamic Tuning driver to disable the trip point.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ Hot Thermal Trip Point

knob.name: ThermalSamplingPeriodSA
knob.description: The polling interval in 10ths of seconds. A value of 0 tells the driver to use interrupts. NOTE: The granularity of the sampling period is 0.1 seconds. For example, if the sampling period is 30 seconds, then _TSP needs to report 300; if the sampling period is 0.5 seconds, then choose 5.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ Thermal Sampling Period

knob.name: PpccStepSize
knob.description: Step size for Turbo power limit (RAPL) control
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ PPCC Step Size

knob.name: MinPowerLimit0
knob.description: This value provides the minimum power limit in the PPCC object for this platform at cTDP Level 0 (Nominal). Enter the value in milliwatts with 125mw granularity.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ Minimum Power Limit (cTDP Nom)

knob.name: MinPowerLimit1
knob.description: This value provides the minimum power limit in the PPCC object for this platform cTDP Level 1 (Down). Enter the value in milliwatts with 125mw granularity.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ Minimum Power Limit (cTDP Down)

knob.name: MinPowerLimit2
knob.description: This value provides the minimum power limit in the PPCC object for this platform cTDP Level 2 (Up). Enter the value in milliwatts with 125mw granularity.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ Minimum Power Limit (cTDP up)

knob.name: LPOEnable
knob.description: Instructs the policy to use Active Cores if they are available.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ CLPO Enable

knob.name: LPOStartPState
knob.description: Instructs the policy when to initiate Active Core control if enabled. Note: 16-LFM
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ CLPO Start PState

knob.name: LPOStepSize
knob.description: Instructs the policy to take away logical processors in the specified percentage steps.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ CLPO Step Size

knob.name: LPOPowerControlSetting
knob.description: Instructs the policy whether to use Core offlining or SMT offlining if Active core control is enabled to be used in P0 or when power control is applied.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ CLPO Power Control

knob.name: LPOPerformanceControlSetting
knob.description: Instructs the policy whether to use Core offlining or SMT offlining if Active core control is enabled to be used in P1 or when performance control is applied.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ CLPO Performance Control

knob.name: EnableCtdpPolicy
knob.description: Enable/Disable Intel Configurable TDP
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/ ConfigTDP

knob.name: EnableDCFG
knob.description: An Integer containing the Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration bitmap: BIT0[Generic UI Access Control](0-enable,1-disable) BIT1[Restricted UI Access Control](0-enable,1-disable) BIT2[shell Access Control](0-enable,1-disable) BIT3[Environment Monitoring Report Control](0-report,1-silent) BIT4[Thermal Mitigation Report Control](0-silent,1-report) BIT5[Thermal Policy Report Control](0-silent,1-report)
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Thermal Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration/Intel(R) Dynamic Tuning Configuration

knob.name: UsbXhciSupport
knob.description: Enable/Disable XHCI Pre-Boot Driver support. Definition of ?Pre-Boot? means before OS is booted. Pre-Boot Driver refer to a piece of code inside the BIOS that controls input and output operations during boot time. This options decide if BIOS USB driver is 3.0 aware or not.

knob.name: UsbXhciHandoff
knob.description: This is a workaround for OSes without XHCI hand-off support. The XHCI ownership change should be claimed by XHCI driver.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/LEGACY USB Configuration/XHCI Hand-off

knob.name: UsbEhciHandoff
knob.description: This is a workaround for OSes without EHCI hand-off support. The EHCI ownership change should be claimed by EHCI driver.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/LEGACY USB Configuration/EHCI Hand-off

knob.name: UsbMassDriverSupport
knob.description: Enable/Disable USB Mass Storage Driver Support.
knob.depex: (UsbMainSupport != 0) AND ((SYSTEM_ACCESS.Access != 1) AND (( UsbControllerNum.UhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.OhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.EhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.XhciNum != 0)))
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/LEGACY USB Configuration/USB Mass Storage Driver Support

knob.name: UsbControlTimeOut
knob.description: The time-out value for Control, Bulk, and Interrupt transfers.
knob.depex: (UsbMainSupport != 0) AND ((SYSTEM_ACCESS.Access != 1) AND (( UsbControllerNum.UhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.OhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.EhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.XhciNum != 0)))
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/LEGACY USB Configuration/USB transfer time-out

knob.name: UsbMassResetDelay
knob.description: USB mass storage device Start Unit command time-out.
knob.depex: (UsbMainSupport != 0) AND ((SYSTEM_ACCESS.Access != 1) AND (( UsbControllerNum.UhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.OhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.EhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.XhciNum != 0)))
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/LEGACY USB Configuration/Device reset time-out

knob.name: PowerGoodDeviceDelay
knob.description: Maximum time the device will take before it properly reports itself to the Host Controller. ?Auto? uses default value: for a Root port it is 100 ms, for a Hub port the delay is taken from Hub descriptor.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/LEGACY USB Configuration/Device power-up delay

knob.name: PowerGoodDeviceNumDelay
knob.description: Delay range is 1..40 seconds, in one second increments
knob.depex: (PowerGoodDeviceDelay != 0) AND ((SYSTEM_ACCESS.Access != 1) AND (( UsbControllerNum.UhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.OhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.EhciNum != 0) OR (UsbControllerNum.XhciNum != 0)))
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/LEGACY USB Configuration/Device power-up delay in seconds

knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Intel ICC/ICC/OC Watchdog Timer

knob.name: IccPllShutdownEnabled
knob.description: This option controls the programming of the ICC PLL shutdown flow. When enabled, this ICC PM register will be programmed on every non-Sx boot.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Intel ICC/ICC PLL Shutdown

knob.name: BclkChangeWarmReset
knob.description: Changes how the BCLK frequency changes are applied permanent with warm reset. 0 - Disabled. 1 - Enabled.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Intel ICC/ Bclk Change Permanent

knob.name: BclkChangeContinues
knob.description: Changes how the BCLK frequency changes are applied. 0 - Realtime. 1 - Permanent, without warm reset. NOTE: Realtime changes will be applied when ?F4? hotkey is pressed. Uses MEI SET_CLOCK_SETTINGS command 0x1B.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Intel Advanced Menu/Intel ICC/ Bclk Change w/o Reset

knob.name: BoardReworkComplainceEnable

knob.name: SkipHIIUpdate
knob.description: If Enabled, skip updating HII database strings in setup menu
knob.SetupPgPtr: Boot Configuration Menu/ Skip Setup HII Update

knob.name: ConInBehavior
knob.description: Select how to enumerate console inputs. - Windows Console: No input consoles will be enumerated. - PS/2 Console: BIOS will check if PS/2 keyboard is connected or not. If connected, BIOS will only connect to PS/2 keyboard else BIOS will enumerate USB keyboard. - Reconnect Last Good Input Consoles: Enumerate all Console input devices that were enumerated in previous FULL boot.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Boot Configuration Menu/ Console Input Behavior

knob.name: LazyConIn
knob.description: Enable Lazy ConIn
knob.SetupPgPtr: Boot Configuration Menu/Enable Lazy ConIn

knob.name: VirtualKeyboard
knob.description: Enables/Disables Virtual Keyboard in BIOS
knob.SetupPgPtr: Boot Configuration Menu/Enable Virtual Keyboard

knob.name: BootFirstToShell
knob.prompt: Enforce Shell as the first boot
knob.description: Enforce Shell as the first boot option.
knob.SetupPgPtr: Boot Configuration Menu/Enforce Shell as the first boot

knob.name: AttemptSecureBoot
knob.description: Enable or Disable the Secure Boot feature after platform reset

knob.name: BootOrder_0
knob.description: Boot Order Index 0

knob.description: Boot Order Index 1

knob.description: Boot Order Index 2
